title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB:
The test.class file is put in the subpackage\\subpackage directory. This means running the java command results in an exception:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage.Test
EB: The behavior should be the same as javac.
SR:
1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Compile the class using the command: ajc subpackage\\Test.java
3. Run the compiled file using the command: java subpackage.Test
